nl: Prove that $\frac{(x+2)^p-2^p}{x}$, where $p$ is an odd prime, is irreducible in $\mathbb{Z}[x]$.
lean:
∀ {p : ℕ} (hp : p.Prime ∧ p > 2)
  {f : Polynomial ℤ} (hf : f = (X + 2)^p):
  Irreducible (∑ n in (f.support \ {0}), (f.coeff n : Polynomial ℤ) * X ^ (n-1), Polynomial ℤ)
candidate: ∀ {p : ℕ} (hp : Nat.Prime p) (f : Polynomial ℤ) : f = Polynomial.C (2 : ℤ) ^ p - 2 ^ p → ∀ (g, Polynomial ℤ), g ∣ f → g = Polynomial.C 1 ∨ g = f
imports:
import Mathlib

open Fintype Subgroup Set Polynomial Ideal
open scoped BigOperators
